alert.note: Alert for Pierce (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 10:37AM PST until January 07 at 1:20PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... South Prairie Creek at South Prairie affecting Pierce County. .Heavy rain along the Central Coast, Southwest Interior, South Slopes of the Olympics and the Central and Southern Washington Cascades combined with snowmelt will continue to cause flooding today. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...South Prairie Creek at South Prairie. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM PST Friday the flow was 3080.0 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM PST Friday was 6300.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 328.5 cfs late Monday morning. - Flood flow is 4000.0 cfs. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 130 PM PST.
